stories.headline: Work is killing me! Lax labor laws imperil Texas teens
stories.summary: Nancy Stancill from the Houston Chronicle investigates the dangers faced by Texas teenagers due to weak child labor laws, revealing over 13,000 injuries including deaths among teenage workers within a three-year span.

stories.headline: Reporters find FEMA's secret funding of fallout shelter
stories.summary: Larry Lipman and Elliot Jaspin uncover FEMA's secret expenditure of $2.9 billion on a nuclear war program, which had been hidden even from many government officials.

stories.headline: Nine-track tape drive provides easy and dependable backup
stories.summary: Elliot Jaspin details his experience with using a nine-track tape drive as a reliable backup solution for his computer data storage needs.

stories.headline: Enthusiasm for computer-assisted reporting is keen although broadcasters are leery of cost VS. return
stories.summary: Michelle Smawley discusses the growing interest among journalists in computer-assisted reporting, while broadcasters remain cautious due to cost concerns.
